Multiple variables to unique date variable

Source: R/vars_to_date.R
vars_to_date.Rd

Multiple variables to unique date variable

Usage

vars_to_date(
  tbl,
  year = NULL,
  quarter = NULL,
  month = NULL,
  day = NULL,
  date = NULL,
  drop_vars = TRUE,
  clean_names = FALSE,
  date_format = "%d-%m-%y",
  origin = "1900-01-01"
)

Arguments

tbl

data.frame or tbl connection

year

year variable position or name

quarter

quarter variable position or name

month

month variable position or name

day

day variable position or name

date

a variable name or position containing a like date format

drop_vars

indicates if variables should be dropped

clean_names

indicates if all variable names should be cleaned

date_format

actual date format of variable in date argument

origin

base date for variable convertion to date

Value

tbl a new data.frame with the compute variable

Examples

tbl <- data.frame(
  year = rep("2021", 12),
  month = month.name,
  day = sample(1:3, 12, TRUE),
  value = sample(100:1000, 12, TRUE)
)

tbl
#>    year     month day value
#> 1  2021   January   1   390
#> 2  2021  February   3   172
#> 3  2021     March   3   503
#> 4  2021     April   2   564
#> 5  2021       May   3   175
#> 6  2021      June   3   969
#> 7  2021      July   3   827
#> 8  2021    August   2   817
#> 9  2021 September   3   935
#> 10 2021   October   2   409
#> 11 2021  November   2   752
#> 12 2021  December   2   198

vars_to_date(tbl, year = 1, month = 2, day = 3)
#>          date value
#> 1  2021-01-01   390
#> 2  2021-02-03   172
#> 3  2021-03-03   503
#> 4  2021-04-02   564
#> 5  2021-05-03   175
#> 6  2021-06-03   969
#> 7  2021-07-03   827
#> 8  2021-08-02   817
#> 9  2021-09-03   935
#> 10 2021-10-02   409
#> 11 2021-11-02   752
#> 12 2021-12-02   198
